sense.name: a wax closure on a document
sense.examples: Mary likes to close her personal letters with a red wax seal. The king broke the seal on the scroll and opened it up.

sense.name: an official stamp providing authentication of document
sense.examples: The front page of the letter bore an official government seal. The university seal on this diploma may have actually been forged.

sense.name: the thick fur of a marine mammal
sense.examples: She modeled two coats for the client, one of mink and one of seal. Seal is a very warm fur.

sense.name: a state of endorsement or approval
sense.examples: The former president has not given his seal of approval to the candidate. The bailout plan has the seal of approval of the Treasury department.

sense.name: coating used as a repellant to moisture
sense.examples: The oil primer makes a good seal for the wood against moisture. The artist completed the oil painting with a light seal of varnish.

sense.name: device that is a tight-fitting closure
sense.examples: The seals on these engine valves need replacing. Mary used rubber rings as seals for her canning jars.

sense.name: a marine mammal
sense.examples: The kayakers saw hundreds of seals sitting on rocks in the harbor. The activists sprayed the baby seals with green paint to protect them from hunters.

sense.name: a state of imperviousness
sense.examples: Many fittings have tapered threads to provide a better seal. The denture cream did not provide a lasting seal between the gums and the dentures.
